author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
Gives liberty to the police to arrest the AAP leader if his custodial interrogation is required in the course of probe

In a major blow to the ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), party leader Kumar Vishwas will shortly be facing a criminal case for alleged molestation of an AAP volunteer. The 46-year-old poet-turned-politician has denied any wrongdoing.

A Metropolitan Magistrate’s court here on Wednesday ordered the police to register a First Information Report against him on the woman’s complaint.

The court gave liberty to the police to arrest Mr. Vishwas if his custodial interrogation was required in the course of investigation.

“The investigation shall be done uninfluenced and the arrest be made when required,” directed the Magistrate
title: Kumar Vishwas to face FIR on molestation plea
